thread.title: Outdoor festivals, theatre and arts: The best things to do this week
thread.title_full: Outdoor festivals, theatre and arts: The best things to do this week

title: Outdoor festivals, theatre and arts: The best things to do this week
text:
Outdoor festivals, theatre and arts: The best things to do this week Outdoor festivals, theatre and arts: The best things to do this week SUMMER arts, fun festivals, wakeboarding and theatre are this week’s hot tickets. PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 00:01, Sun, Jul 19, 2015 PH Head to the north Devon countryside for five days of fun at Somersault festival 
DO 
Head to the north Devon countryside for five days of music, culture and outdoor fun at Somersault festival. From Thursday to next Monday, visitors to Castle Hill can enjoy a hearty feast, watch world-class acts on stage, join the circus and take to the water on their own hand-built bodysurfing plane. 
Headliners this year include Bombay Bicycle Club, Rae Morris and Laura Marling. A long weekend ticket costs £135. Visit somersaultfestival.com . 
WATCH 
Experience theatrical murder mystery The Curious Incident Of The Dog In The Night-Time at the Liverpool Empire from Tuesday to Saturday as part of its UK tour. 
Adapted from Mark Haddon’s bestselling novel, the story follows 15-year-old Christopher, who is suspected of killing his neighbour’s dog. Challenging his Asperger’s-like condition and his detective skills, the teen embarks on a frightening journey away from home in a bid solve the crime. Tickets cost from £11.90. The tour finishes in Milton Keynes on November 7. Visit curiousonstage.com . 
GO TO 
Head to Liverpool’s Albert Dock on Saturday to witness talented wakeboarders from around the world taking to the water for Red Bull Harbour Reach. Back in Liverpool for a third year, the UK’s biggest wakeboarding contest welcomes reigning champion James Windsor of Australia along with UK stars Jonty Green and Freddy Carter. 
Spectators will see impressive stunts, jumps, rails and obstacles from 360-degree viewing platforms. The free event is from 2pm to 6pm. Visit redbull.com . 
VISIT 
London’s Tate Modern is hosting a summer celebration of culture on Saturday. 
The Turbine Festival will be held from 12.30pm to 9.30pm and includes a huge variety of entertainment and things to do. An audio-visual mix of music, performance, installations and activities will include beatboxing and poetry workshops, an alternative hair salon, live music from the likes of Afrikan Boy (above) and highlights from the London Short Film Festival. 
You can also submit your photographs via social media and see them displayed on the day for the project My Culture Museum. Visit tate.org.uk . Related articles
